block.p: Consumer prices rose two-tenths of 1 percent in August, the same as in July. . . . Fewer foreign cars and cheaper oil meant that the nation's imports fell in July. But exports fell faster, reflecting soft demand in troubled Asian countries. So the trade deficit widened to $13.92 billion. . . . Sluggish sales in Asia hammered Nike, whose profits fell 35 percent in the latest quarter. . . . Three former executives of Archer Daniels Midland, including the chairman's son, were found guilty of conspiring to fix prices of lysine, the animal feed additive.

Sluggish sales in Asia hammered Nike, whose profits fell 35 percent in the latest quarter. . . . Three former executives of Archer Daniels Midland, including the chairman's son, were found guilty of conspiring to fix prices of lysine, the animal feed additive.
